column4: Hi, I have a question about un-installing Ubuntu.... long story short, I have a disk image of my previous XP installation, on a separate hard drive.... Can I just pop in the Ghost CD and reimage this hard drive (there are no partitions other than Ubuntu, I think), and it will bring me back to where I was?
why you want to get rid of Ubuntu?
that kind of thing can be set up in a Linux distro as well
you can set up Internet filters and so on
don't give up
most of the Internet runs on Linux :)
quite a few companies and so on are going Linux
on there networks etc
I know, that's why I wanted to switch! Yet, I need a solution, like, now.
try finding one in ##linux
that's another IRC channel?
yes
and a general Linux one
OK, thanks! If I don't find anything, can I just stick in the ghost CD and reimage? Just point the destination to my main drive? There are no partitions except those that Ubuntu generates, if any
yes I assume so, but  you want to get away from Windows :)
and I know what you want to do can be done, I just don't have the details
OK, great - thanks!
now there will be a bit of a learning curve for what you want to do,  you will have to use commands and such probably
,but  if you don't give up, the results should be rather good :)
so I just reimage, basically, and don't worry about partitions?
yeah just delete the partitions, or use Ghost
that should do it
